intro: Hysterobaeckea ochropetala subsp. ochropetala, commonly known as the yellow everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and is adapted to dry, sandy soils. It is often found in coastal and inland regions, thriving in full sun. Its floral structure and color make it a popular choice for garden use in arid landscapes.
